story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Technical Machine
caption: tessel.io
description: Tessel is a microcontroller that runs JavaScript. It's Node-compatible and ships with Wifi built in. Use it to easily make physical devices that connect to the web.

data.message:
yea, javascript will rule :) checkout nodecopter 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hhpsaITWMoY
bl3aks javascript has w great opportunity 3shan the number of developers eho develop in javascript is way greater than C developers

Way greater? That's a stretch.

The number of developers that do Javascript in what sense in comparison to C? 
Javascript is first and foremost a scripting language not a full-featured programming language. The reason it's gaining traction is the node.js environment and toolchain.

The number of node.js developers as compared to C is far lower than what one would normally anticipate in a knee-jerk assumption.

You have thousands upon thousands of packages for every flavour that has ever existed and is still maintained of *nix systems. Most of which are either in C or C++

You have the hundreds of developers contributing daily to the maintenance of these *nix systems. Not to mention the grand majority of most language implementations including node.js and most of your favourite browsers are all either in C, C++ or both. And the thousands of contributing developers + their core teams.

Game engines, toolchains, mission-critical commercial quality software deployments from space programs to missile guidance systems. Most of weapon grade code development deployed in some of the most sophisticated war machinery out there. From helicopters to tanks.

Cars, factory automation systems, satellites, receivers and broad casting technologies. Most of the embedded technologies.

It's all either C, C++ or something built on-top or in C or C++. I think it's a fair bet to say C-family engineers out number any other technology out there.

Now if we are talking about Javascript as a client-side scripting language, then that's a whole different story.

Edit: Javascript as a community has potential. If its community ever turns into more backend engineers than frontend engineers. The knowledge set of a backend engineer differs greatly than that of a frontend engineer.
جافا سكريبت وامبدد سيستم دونت ميكس =D

Ahmed El-Jabry some crazy developers just like to mix stuff keda, .Net on Android, .Net on a Microprocessor (netduino), Windows on ARM, (Macromedia!) Flash for Airline Schedule Screens (Egy Airlines! lol!), Prolog for ... anything really, Erlang for a 3D Modelling Program (Wings3D), Java for 3D Games that consume gigs of memory (Minecraft), Shakespeare and programming, all these are crazy, magatsh 3ala JavaScript on Embedded Systems :D

javascript(Front End,Back End,Embedded Systems, 
leave the arc open =D

Hady Ahmed i liked you previous conversation bgad, fair enough you've convinced me. that's right about what you said about nodejs. actually this community is getting viral in no time. even the js community as a whole is getting even more and more. but i've no idea which of the two communities (C or js) is gaining more support(but i think at this point js wins). also the number of node packages is getting bigger in no time too which i don't think i happens in C or C++ communities. BTW i believe that C is way better and more reliable that js. js is a very weak language. BTW im a backend engineer :D

Alaa I agree :D

Hassan in all fairness, I like the the spaghetti. Erlang though, we've moved most of our infrastructure in Tabshora to Erlang since April 2013, wing3D was a real stretch :D can't say it was a bad decision though. There's a lot more to it than most people think.

Ahmed I wouldn't jump too soon to that conclusion.

Hady Ahmed I like that spaghetti too, specially ones with "Mono" in them, MonoRail? MonoTorrent? Mono on Raspberry Pi? MonoGame? Port Android to Mono?
I find all these stuff interesting :)
fun fact: that last one actually led to a performance improvement :D
